body:
Seems related (on another run):

```
  1) GRPC::RpcServer#run with no connect_metadata should not receive metadata if the client times out
     Failure/Error: t = Thread.new { @srv.run }
     GRPC::Core::CallError:
       start_batch completion failed
     # ./lib/grpc/generic/rpc_server.rb:443:in `run_batch'
     # ./lib/grpc/generic/rpc_server.rb:443:in `new_active_server_call'
     # ./lib/grpc/generic/rpc_server.rb:423:in `loop_handle_server_calls'
     # ./lib/grpc/generic/rpc_server.rb:383:in `run'
     # ./spec/generic/rpc_server_spec.rb:410:in `block (5 levels) in <top (required)>'
     # /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.1.5/gems/logging-2.0.0/lib/logging/diagnostic_context.rb:448:in `call'
     # /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.1.5/gems/logging-2.0.0/lib/logging/diagnostic_context.rb:448:in `block in create_with_logging_context'
  2) GRPC::RpcServer#run with no connect_metadata should handle cancellation correctly
     Failure/Error: t = Thread.new { @srv.run }
     GRPC::Core::CallError:
       start_batch completion failed
     # ./lib/grpc/generic/rpc_server.rb:443:in `run_batch'
     # ./lib/grpc/generic/rpc_server.rb:443:in `new_active_server_call'
     # ./lib/grpc/generic/rpc_server.rb:423:in `loop_handle_server_calls'
     # ./lib/grpc/generic/rpc_server.rb:383:in `run'
     # ./spec/generic/rpc_server_spec.rb:426:in `block (5 levels) in <top (required)>'
     # /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.1.5/gems/logging-2.0.0/lib/logging/diagnostic_context.rb:448:in `call'
     # /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.1.5/gems/logging-2.0.0/lib/logging/diagnostic_context.rb:448:in `block in create_with_logging_context'
```
The test in the bug report has been deleted in #3494
